expected_issues.description: SSRI (Escitalopram) added to dual antiplatelet therapy - excessive bleeding risk
expected_issues.reasoning: SSRIs inhibit platelet serotonin reuptake, impairing platelet aggregation and increasing bleeding risk. Patient on dual antiplatelet therapy (aspirin + clopidogrel) post-MI. Adding SSRI creates triple antiplatelet effect, dramatically increasing risk of major bleeding (GI hemorrhage, intracranial bleeding). Studies show 2-3x increased bleeding risk with SSRI + antiplatelet combination. Should use alternative antidepressant without antiplatelet effects (bupropion, mirtazapine) or add PPI for GI protection.
